docs.lead_paragraph: By fighting mock battles with its siblings a lion cub masters skills useful for bringing down zebras, and a child learns tactics helpful for survival in a competitive human society. Scientists, like cubs and children, also play, in more sophisticated ways.

headline.main: And Now, 'The Court Jester in the Palace of Science'

docs.abstract: Malcolm W Browne essay hails Dr David E H Jones, who has been tweaking scientific orthodoxies under then pen name Daedalus for 36 years, on occasion of publication of The Further Inventions of Daedalus; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: By fighting mock battles with its siblings a lion cub masters skills useful for bringing down zebras, and a child learns tactics helpful for survival in a competitive human society.    Scientists, like cubs and children, also play, in more...

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Sylvia Ann Hewlett (Op-Ed, May 16) correctly points out that society gets ''the big payoff'' from working parents' ''expensively raised children.'' On the flip side, this country's reluctance to provide the socializing influence and early problem-detection abilities of free, quality day care for all children results in losses to society many times greater than the cost of such care.
docs.abstract: Letter from Judith Green says America's reluctance to provide socializing influence and early problem-detection abilities of free, quality day care for all children results in losses to society many times greater than cost of such care
